description: Family Meal Factors Framework - 10 factors for scoring dishes

kid_friendly.survey_column: Child 1 (youngest):How did your child(ren) react to the meal?
kid_friendly.description: Kids will actually eat it - familiar flavours, not too spicy

scoring.5: Universally kid-friendly, mild by default, familiar presentation
scoring.4: Most kids will eat, familiar ingredients, appealing look
scoring.3: Some kids will eat with mild option or adaptation

balanced_guilt_free.survey_column: Healthy option:Why did you choose this dish?
balanced_guilt_free.description: Parents feel good serving it on a Tuesday - not a treat, a proper meal

scoring.5: Clearly balanced meal, visible protein + veg + carbs, grilled/healthy
scoring.4: Mostly balanced, some vegetables included, not too heavy
scoring.3: Neutral - can go either way depending on presentation
scoring.2: Indulgent but has some redeeming qualities
scoring.1: Pure treat/indulgence, not a balanced meal

adult_appeal.survey_column: How did you feel about the meal?
adult_appeal.description: Adults enjoy it too - important for non-parent orderers

scoring.4: Adults genuinely enjoy it, good flavours
scoring.3: Adults tolerate it, basic but acceptable
scoring.2: More kid-focused, adults wouldn't choose it
scoring.1: Adults wouldn't order this for themselves

portion_flexibility.survey_column: There was enough food for everyone:Please rate how much you agree or disagree

scoring.4: Sharing platters or 4 individual portions work well
scoring.3: Can be ordered in quantities for 4
scoring.2: Individual portions only, awkward for family
scoring.1: Single-serve only, not suitable for family sharing

fussy_eater_friendly.evidence: 1,037 mentions of fussy eaters as barrier
fussy_eater_friendly.description: Mild options available, customisable for picky kids

scoring.5: Mild by default, universally appealing, no 'scary' ingredients
scoring.4: Mild option available, familiar ingredients throughout
scoring.3: Can be made mild on request
scoring.2: Some unfamiliar ingredients, may need adaptation
scoring.1: Spicy/complex by nature, difficult to adapt

customisation.description: Individual preferences can be accommodated within the order

scoring.1: No customisation, take it or leave it

value_at_25.survey_column: Good value for money:Why did you choose this dish?
value_at_25.description: Feels worth it for a family of 4 at the £25 price point

scoring.5: Excellent value, generous portions, premium feel
scoring.2: Slightly expensive for what you get

shareability.description: Can come in one big portion for family sharing at the table

scoring.3: Can be shared with some effort

vegetarian_option.description: Good veggie alternative available (not an afterthought)

on_dinneroo_menu.description: Actually available on Dinneroo (verified against menu catalog)

scoring.5: Widely available (50+ menu items across partners)

score_conversion.description: Convert survey success rates to 1-5 scores

evidence_types.Measured: 3+ factors have direct survey data (n≥5 per dish)
evidence_types.Blended: 1-2 factors have survey data, rest estimated
